msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: Unknown number of fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: H. S. 159; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 9 lines per page; Dimensions: 330 x 483mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1260 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 30: "91 H. S. 159. Aynı. Aharlı kâğıt. 483mm boy ve 330mm eninde … yaprak. Sahifede harekeli iri nesihle 163mm 9 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eliyle 658 (1260)de istinsah edilmiştir. İlk iki sahifesi ile son sahifeleri ve Kurʿan falını havi üç sahifesi, sure başları, satır araları, güller müzehhep, durak ve cetveller yaldız ve renkli. Miklepli ve sıvama yaldızlı kabartmalı vişne çürüğü deri İran cildi, kapak içleri aynı tarzda işlidir."

This can be translated as follows: "91 H. S. 159. Same. Sized paper. … leaves of 483 mm height and 330 mm width. The text area written in large naskh with diacritics, [contains] 9 lines measuring 163 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 658 (1260). The first two and the last leaves, and three folios containing Qurʾānic divination?, sūra beginnings, interlinear spaces, roses are illuminated; verse seperators and the rule-borders are gilded and colored. Cherrybrown Persian leather, with flap (miklep) and gilding (sıvama yaldız), inside covers are decorated in the same style.”
